produceInfo.title: K
produceInfo.description: Kale is a hardy vegetable that can be grown in the spring. It is low maintenance and can be harvested when the leaves are young and tender.
produceInfo.tipOne: Kale seeds can be started indoors 4-6 weeks before the last frost date in your area. This will give them a head start and help them grow stronger before being transplanted outside.
produceInfo.tipTwo: Kale prefers soil that is rich in organic matter, well-drained, and slightly acidic with a pH between 6.0 and 7.0. Amend the soil with compost or aged manure to provide the necessary nutrients.
produceInfo.tipThree: Kale needs regular watering to grow properly. Keep the soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged. Water deeply once or twice a week, depending on the weather and soil conditions. Avoid getting water on the leaves, as this can encourage fungal diseases.
